subject: RE: [junit] Comparing arrays in JUnit 4
msgSnippet: ... Perhaps use some reflection in assertEquals(Object, Object) to handle arrays in the desired way? (Should even work with pre-5 Java.) Cheers, Ilja
messageBody:
> Short of adding 162 different methods to compare each and every
> possible combination of arrays (something I would not rule out but it
> certainly wouldn't be my first choice) does anyone see a reasonable
> way to use Java 5 autoboxing to allow arrays of primitive data types
> to be compared?

Perhaps use some reflection in assertEquals(Object, Object) to handle arrays
in the desired way? (Should even work with pre-5 Java.)

Cheers, Ilja
